title: Collaborative Mobile Microlearning Design for 21st-Century Engineering Education Innovation

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced courses and extensive practical experience in specialized fields
context.additional_context: A faculty competency enhancement program for pre-service or in-service teachers. Learners are advanced professionals who, as ordinary citizens, resonate with the necessity of modernizing engineering education. Collaborative learning is conducted in a mobile-based environment that restructures practical experiences linked to industrial settings

learning_goals: Learners can explain automation processes of engineering lab equipment in three or more ways via mobile platforms
Learners can propose two or more real-time problem-solving solutions with peers using digital collaboration tools
Learners can simulate a ubiquitous engineering environment (virtual/remote lab), then derive three or more improvement points through peer evaluation
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
